TEXT.about: If you like Moro please consider donating to an NGO or humanitarian organization on our behalf.
TEXT.addNoteSuccess: Your note is added! see it in reports\o/
TEXT.clearDataWarning: [BE CAREFUL] If you surely want to clear all data in moro run: moro clear --yes
TEXT.helpTip: Run moro --help to learn how to edit your clock in, clock out or break duration for today
TEXT.clockOutTip: Tip: next time you run moro, you will clock out!

commands.default: Track your work hours. Just say moro when you come to work, and say moro when you leave. It shows how long you have worked on that day!
commands.hi: example: "moro hi 09:45" registers your clock in at 09:45!
commands.hiStart: Specify start time if not now
commands.bye: example: "moro bye 17:45" registers your clock out at 17:45
commands.byeEnd: Specify your clock out time if not now. e.g 17:45
commands.break: example: 'moro break 45' Set the total amount of unpaid break for today to 45 minutes. 30 minutes is added by default for lunch. Use this command to enter the correct amount
commands.breakDuration: Specify the duration of break in minutes. e.g 45
commands.report: See what you have done today!. Just like 'status'
commands.status: See how long you have worked until now, same as report!
commands.clearYes: you need to confirm before I remove everything
commands.config:
example: 'moro config --day 8' Sets  duration of full working day to 8 hours. 
 moro config --break 45 sets the default break duration to 45 minutes. 
 moro config --format 'dd, YYYY-MM-DD' sets the report format of dates to 'Th, 2017-03-21' 
 moro config --database-path /home/GraceHopper/moro.db sets the database path. If the file doesn't exist it will be made
commands.configDay: example: 'moro config --day 8' How many hours make a full day e.g 7.5 hours
commands.configBreak: example: 'moro config --break 45' Sets your proffered default break time to 45 minutes
commands.configPattern: example: moro config --format 'YYYY-MM-DD' Sets the pattern for the date format in a report
commands.dbPath: example: moro config --database-path '/home/GraceHopper/moro.db' Sets the path to the database file. You can save your database in your dropbox to enjoy automatic backups!
commands.note: optionally add notes about the task at hand
commands.noteNote: free form note about task at hand

sync.allDone: All sync job has been done.
